data.title: Now offering Gay Marriage
data.text: My Husband and I finally are able to recognize our marriage. We were treated great at our City Hall marriage by all of the employees here.

data.title: Nice modern municipal building. Staff professional- addition of 4 Rivers is a nice touch.
data.text: The taxpayers of the city have paid for a nice building which seems to be organized well. The employees are generally professional and easy to deal with. My only complaint is that in order to get a security pass to get past security you have to enter an ID into a machine which prints out a paper pass which your information. It is offensive that you have to possess and ID and the machine seems to capture the data on your driver's license. A physical security screening in my opinion should be all that is required to enter a government building.

data.title: Business - Art Gallery - Restaurant - Outdoor Seating
data.text: If you are in downtown and just want to take a look around, City Hall has a lot to offer.  It has a FREE Art Gallery on the 1st floor, little Restaurants, Seating area outside, and you can do business.

data.title: "Municipal Building"
data.text: City of Orlando City Hall is a place where you can go to get information and planning for a projects, remodeling permits for owners who leave in city limits.

data.title: Very Average
data.text: This is not the prettiest city hall I have seen. The building lacks charm and the structure is very average looking. It looks just like most other buildings in Downtown Orlando.

data.title: Interesante visita al Ayuntamiento de Orlando
data.text:
El Ayuntamiento de Orlando, permite visitas a su edificio durante su horario de apertura (de lunes a viernes, de 8 a 17).

Fuera de ese horario, te dejan entrar en el Hall y visitar la exposición de la planta baja. Es lo que hicimos nosotros al ser un sábado cuando fuimos.

Muy amable el personal.
